data.title: Ivo Andrić
data.meta_description: Ivo Andrić - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or view presentation slides online. Ivo Andrić (1892-1975) was a Yugoslav writer who received the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1961. He was born in Bosnia and Herzegovina when it was part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Andrić studied at several universities and worked as a diplomat before focusing on writing full-time. His most famous work, The Bridge on the Drina, chronicles the history of Bosnia and the interaction between Eastern and Western influences in the region. Andrić is considered the greatest Yugoslav writer and the only one to win the Nobel Prize in Literature.
